title: on The Expansion of Latin Europe, 1000–1500, brings together 22 articles, previously published elsewhere between 1972 and 2012. The volume is organised in six parts covering important aspects of this part of medieval expansion. The articles in Part I (Travel, Trade and Economy) are “Coastal Shipping and Navigation in the Mediterranean” by Michel Balard
The Geographical Conditions of Galley Navigation in the Mediterranean
and “Byzantine Crete in the Navigation and Trade Networks of Venice and Genoa
